lead_paragraph: West Virginia University and its former coach, Rich Rodriguez, will have a hearing April 3 in Monongalia County Circuit Court. Judge Robert Stone set the date and will hear several motions and counterclaims filed in the university’s lawsuit concerning a $4 million buyout clause in Rodriguez’s contract.Rodriguez resigned in December to take the coaching job at Michigan, taking some of his coaches and recruits with him. The university says that Rodriguez owes the full amount he agreed to pay in his contract. Rodriguez says that the agreement he signed included certain verbal promises, among them the reduction or elimination of the buyout clause — a promise the university denies.
